nodes.body:
### PR summary [832f6e3d33](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/pull/21820/commits/832f6e3d3307a6fc16ce728c78c6ccda66cdb1ac)

#### Import changes for modified files

No significant changes to the import graph


<details><summary>Import changes for all files</summary>

|Files|Import difference|
|-|-|

</details>

---

#### Declarations diff

No declarations were harmed in the making of this PR! üêô
<details>
  <summary>You can run this locally as follows</summary>


```bash
## summary with just the declaration names:
./scripts/declarations_diff.sh <optional_commit>

## more verbose report:
./scripts/declarations_diff.sh long <optional_commit>
```
</details>

The doc-module for `script/declarations_diff.sh` contains some details about this script.

---

<details><summary>No changes to technical debt.</summary>

You can run this locally as
```
./scripts/technical-debt-metrics.sh pr_summary
```
* The `relative` value is the weighted *sum* of the differences with weight given by the *inverse* of the current value of the statistic.
* The `absolute` value is the `relative` value divided by the total sum of the inverses of the current values (i.e. the weighted *average* of the differences).
</details>
Do we have a replacement for `induction' h : f x`?

> Do we have a replacement for `induction' h : f x`?

I've been using, in my other depriming PRs, a `suffices` to introduce `f x`, then an `intro` and an unprimed `induction`.
Is this approach discussed on Zulip anywhere? I think removing `induction' h : f x` makes mathlib worse.

> Is this approach discussed on Zulip anywhere? I think removing `induction' h : f x` makes mathlib worse.

Then it should be added to the functionality of `induction`.

https://leanprover.zulipchat.com/#narrow/channel/270676-lean4/topic/To.20replace.20.60induction'.20h.20.3A.20f.20x.60/near/499482173

```suggestion
  "induction'"                     "*"      " induction' (?!\w+\s*:)"
```
I think is enough to catch only the `h :`-free versions? Though it's possible that the regex engine doesn't support `(?!`.

On my computer, if I use `./scripts/technical-debt-metrics.sh`, then the `induction'` count gives 0.

If I try to type it out, using `!` gets interpreted as history lookup and if I try to escape it with `\!`, then the count returns 0.

How about using `[^:]*$`?  It may miss some tech debt that should be counted, but it catches something for me: this is the relevant line
```bash
|1152|-140|induction'|
```

With or without escaping `!`, running the script, I get
```bash
|0|0|induction'|
```
(Running the script means both using `./scripts/technical-debt-metrics.sh` and actually typing out the `git grep` regex.)

I would be happy with the simpler regex that simply excludes `:`.

If we want to do this well, maybe this should be reimplemented as a `techDebtsLinter`.

pullRequest.title: feat: add `cases'/induction'` to the technical debt counter
